THE EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM (ESP) PROVIDES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND SUPPORT TO NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION PROJECTS WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS). PARTICIPANTS WILL AID IN THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF PROJECTS THAT BENEFIT THE PUBLIC AND PROVIDE SUPPORT TO NPS EMPLOYEES. THIS PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES TO QUALIFIED INDIVIDUALS 55 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER, WHO HAVE SPECIFIC TECHNICAL SKILLS AND ABILITIES THAT ARE UNAVAILABLE OR UNDERREPRESENTED AT CURRENT NPS STAFFING LEVELS. THE NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARKS PROGRAM SEEKS ASSISTANCE IN REVIEWING AND EVALUATING PROGRAM RECORDS AS NEEDED TO SUPPORT UPDATING NOMINATIONS, WITHDRAWING DESIGNATIONS, AND COLLECTING ADMINISTRATIVE HISTORY. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT CAREER ADVANCEMENT AND PLACEMENT FOR INDIVIDUALS 55 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER.

JOHNSON NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK WITH: A.EVALUATION OF THE LIMITED AVAILABLE EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES B.DEVELOPING PROGRAMMATIC MATERIALS UTILIZING EXISTING ASSETSC.INSTITUTE NEW EDUCATIONAL METHODOLOGIES D.EXPAND THE PARK CAPACITY TO DELIVER FIELD TRIPS WITH LOCAL PARTNER SCHOOLSTHE PROJECT WILL ENTAIL CREATING A NETWORK OF TEACHERS IN THE LOCAL SCHOOL SYSTEMS AND PROVIDING A MEANS TO SCHEDULE VISITS FOR THE CLASSROOMS. THIS WILL PROMOTE SUSTAINABILITY BY PROVIDING REALISTIC PLANNING THAT COORDINATES RESOURCES ACROSS THE INTERPRETIVE DIVISION, GUARANTEEING SUCCESSFUL IMPLEMENTATION OF EDUCATION PROGRAMS.BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT CAREER ADVANCEMENT AND PLACEMENT FOR INDIVIDUALS 55 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER.FOR MORE INFORMATION AND GUIDANCE, REFER TO NPS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE POLICY GUIDANCE DOCUMENT ON USASPENDING.GOV AWARD DESCRIPTIONS (PROJECT ABSTRACTS), OR CONTACT THE NPS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE POLICY OFFICE AT FINANCIAL ASSITANCE POLICY NPS.GOV.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO ALLOW THE NPS TO PROVIDE MENTORSHIP AND TRAINING TO NEW EMPLOYEES IN THE IR1 COMPTROLLER'S OFFICE SO THAT IT CAN BUILD EFFICIENCY AND CAPACITY THROUGHOUT THE FISCAL CLOSE-OUT AND START UP PROCESSES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE PROJECT INCLUDES ONE POSITION TO PROVIDE EXPERTISE IN BUDGET EXECUTION FUNCTIONS. THE ENROLLEE WILL PROVIDE TRAINING AND GUIDANCE IN WBS CREATION AND RELEASE, STATUS OF FUNDS CREATION AND REVIEWS, ASSETS UNDER CONSTRUCTION REPORTING, SPENDING PLAN REVIEWS, REALLOCATION OF FUNDS, BUDGET TRANSFERS, AND CARRYOVER REPORTING.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:MENTOR AND TRAIN TWO GS-12 BUDGET ANALYSTS. THESE TWO ANALYSTS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR REPAIR REHAB, CYCLIC, GREAT AMERICAN OUTDOORS ACT (GAOA), LINE-ITEM CONSTRUCTION (LIC) AND RECREATION FEE FUNDING. THIS PERSON WILL TRAIN IN ALL ASPECTS OF DISTRIBUTING FUNDS AND RECONCILING FUNDS. THIS INCLUDES THE PROCESS OF WORKING WITH WASO ON MOVING FUNDS FOR THESE LARGE PROGRAMS, IN PARTICULAR GAOA AND LIC. TRAINING WILL BE CONDUCTED AN AVERAGE OF 7.5 HOURS/WEEK FOR 20 WEEKS THROUGH THE BUSIEST AND MOST CHALLENGING TIME OF THE YEAR. BOTH ANALYSTS WILL GROW IN EXPERTISE AND EFFICIENCY BY THE END OF THIS PERIOD.RESEARCH AND PROVIDE ADVICE AND GUIDANCE TO PARK SUPERINTENDENTS, ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICERS, DIVISION CHIEFS, PROGRAM MANAGERS, OTHER PARK STAFF, AND ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF ON A VARIETY OF BUDGETARY AND FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT CONCERNS AND ISSUES, SUCH AS APPROPRIATIONS AND FUNDING SOURCES. WRITTEN CORRESPONDENCE AND TEAMS CALLS WILL OCCUR THROUGHOUT THE 20-WEEK PERIOD IN TANDEM WITH THE GS-12 BUDGET ANALYSTS SO THAT THEY GATHER THE NECESSARY KNOWLEDGE BASE TO TROUBLE-SHOOTING ISSUES.MENTOR NPS EMPLOYEES IN THE PREPARATION OF FUND ALLOCATION CHARTS, TABLES, AND SUMMARIES, AUTHORIZATIONS, LIMITATIONS, AND GUIDANCE RELATING TO THE USE OF FUNDS TO EXPEDITIOUSLY ACCOMPLISH ALLOTMENT ADVICE. MENTORING THE GS-12 BUDGET ANALYSTS WILL BE CONDUCTED APPROXIMATELY 3 HOURS A WEEK AS THEY BEGIN TO TAKE ON MORE ADVANCED BUDGET EXECUTION DUTIES. BY THE END OF THE 20 WEEK PERIOD, THE GS-12 BUDGET ANALYSTS WILL BE ABLE TO PREPARE ADVANCED BUDGET EXECUTION PRODUCTS INDEPENDENTLY.REVIEW FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT POLICIES, PRACTICES, TECHNIQUES AND PROCEDURES THAT GUIDE OFFICE FINANCIAL WORK, IDENTIFY THOSE GUIDELINES THAT ARE IN NEED OF REVISION, DEVELOP RECOMMENDATIONS FOR CHANGES, AND ANALYZE THE IMPACT OF CHANGES. REVIEW AND ANALYZE FINANCIAL REPORTS GENERATED BY THE FINANCIAL SYSTEMS. IDENTIFY PROBLEMS AND DISCREPANCIES, DETERMINE IF ADJUSTMENTS OR CORRECTIONS ARE REQUIRED AND THEN TAKE NECESSARY ACTIONS TO CORRECT AND PRODUCE NEEDED REPORTS. THIS PORTION OF THE DUTIES WILL REPRESENT 1.5 HOURS/WEEK AND THE RESULT WILL BE COMPLETED, ACCURATE REPORTS PROVIDED ON A WEEKLY AND MONTHLY BASIS.BENEFICIARIES:THIS AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT THE NPS MISSION AND THE DIRECTORS GOALS OF IMPROVING, STREAMLINING, AND MODERNIZING THE NPS AND BUSINESS PRACTICES, AND ENSURING ACCOUNTABILITY TO OURSELVES, OUR PARTNERS, AND THE AMERICAN PEOPLE. TASKS AND PROJECTS UNDERTAKEN UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT AND AUGMENT THE ABILITY OF THE SERVICE TO MAINTAIN AND SUPPORT OUR PARK UNITS AND PROGRAM OFFICES. ENROLLEES WILL PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL AND TECHNICAL EXPERTISE WHILE WORKING WITH OUR NEW STAFF.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):"LEGACY RECORDS AND CULP'S HILL CULTURAL LANDSCAPE REPORT" AT GETTYSBURG NATIONAL MILITARY PARK WILL ASSIST THE PARK IN COMPLETING CRITICAL BASELINE HISTORICAL DOCUMENTATION WITH EXPERIENCED HISTORIANS THAT ARE FAMILIAR WITH THE RESOURCES AND HISTORY OF THE PARK.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT INCLUDES: 1) SUMMARIZING DETAILED HISTORICAL RECORDS TO DETERMINE LANDSCAPE FEATURES THAT AFFECTED THE OUTCOME OF THE THREE-DAY BATTLE OF GETTYSBURG SO FUTURE MANAGERS CAN MAKE INFORMED DECISIONS ABOUT THE PRESERVATION AND REHABILITATION OF NATIONALLY SIGNIFICANT CHARACTER DEFINING RESOURCES, 2). COMPLETE HISTORY SECTIONS OF THE CULP HILL CULTURAL LANDSCAPE REPORT, A BASELINE DOCUMENT FOR MANAGING SITE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT WILL (1) TO DEVELOP MANAGEMENT SUMMARIES OF RESOURCES THAT AFFECTED THE OUTCOME OF THE BATTLE; (2) COMPLETION OF INDIVIDUAL SUMMARY SPREADSHEETS; (3) COMPLETION OF BIBLIOGRAPHIC MAPPING PROJECT; (4) ASSURE ALL RECORDS ASSOCIATED WITH THESE PROJECTS ARE ORGANIZED AND READY FOR TRANSFER TO THE PARK ARCHIVES.THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT FOR THE CULP'S HILL CULTURAL LANDSCAPE REPORT ARE: (1) TO PREPARE A CONCISE HISTORY OF THE CULP'S HILL AREA FOR INCLUSION IN THE CULTURE LANDSCAPE REPORT FOR CULP'S HILL; (2) ASSURE ALL RECORDS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS RESEARCH PROJECT ARE ORGANIZED FOR INCLUSION IN THE LARGER CULTURAL LANDSCAPE REPORT ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD.BENEFICIARIES:THE VISITING PUBLIC AND FUTURE HISTORIANS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE DOCUMENTATION END FILE PRODUCT.

NPS-FY22-WASO-EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT AND AUGMENT THE CAPACITY OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) TO MEET ITS MISSION GOALS AND OBJECTIVES IN AREAS WHERE IT LACKS SUFFICIENT EXPERTISE, TECHNICAL SKILLS AND/OR CAPACITY. THROUGH THE ENGAGEMENT OF HIGHLY QUALIFIED WORKERS 55 YEARS AND OLDER IN A TEMPORARY CAPACITY, THE NPS CAN IN A COST EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT MANNER MEET ITS STRATEGIC AND MISSION GOALS OF PROTECTING AND MAINTAINING ITS PARK UNITS AND PROVIDE NECESSARY ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT TO FIELD PERSONNEL. PARTICIPANTS IN THIS PROGRAM WILL BE ABLE TO TRANSFER IMPORTANT TECHNICAL EXPERTISE AND EXPERIENCE TO CURRENT NPS EMPLOYEES AND ASSIST WITH PROJECTS THAT PROVIDE A BENEFIT TO THE VISITING PUBLIC.DUE TO FEDERAL STAFF ATTRITION, MESA VERDE NATIONAL PARK NEEDS SUPPORT FOR CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS AT TWO LOCATIONS IN THE PARK THAT ARE EXPECTED TO OCCUR AT THE SAME TIME: (1) REHABILITATE CIVILIAN CONSERVATION CORP (CCC) BARRACKS 5, CHAPIN MESA CCC AREA, AND (2) CONSTRUCT VISITOR CONTACT STATION, WETHERILL MESA. USE OF THE EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM WOULD ALLOW HIGHLY QUALIFIED, EXPERIENCED WORKERS TO PROVIDE IMMEDIATE, TEMPORARY CONSTRUCTION INSPECTOR SUPPORT TO MESA VERDE NATIONAL PARK.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE TWO CONSTRUCTION INSPECTOR ENROLLEES WOULD PROVIDE CONSTRUCTION INSPECTION FOR ADHERENCE TO THE CONTRACT DOCUMENTS AND INDUSTRY STANDARDS, WRITE DAILY INSPECTION REPORTS AND PHOTOGRAPH CONSTRUCTION PROGRESS, AND REPORT TO THE PROJECT MANAGER. THE CONSTRUCTION INSPECTOR ENROLLEES WOULD ALSO REVIEW SUBMITTALS, REQUESTS FOR INFORMATION (RFI) AND CONSTRUCTION DOCUMENTS SUCH AS DRAWINGS, SPECIFICATIONS, AND REPORTS FOR CONSTRUCTABILITY AND PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE PROJECT MANAGER/CONTRACT OFFICER'S REPRESENTATIVE (COR).PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:IT IS EXPECTED THAT CONSTRUCTION WOULD BEGIN IN EARLY AUTUMN OF 2022 AND CONTINUE UNTIL THE WORK IS COMPLETED OR IS STOPPED DUE WINTER WEATHER. IF A STOP IN CONSTRUCTION OCCURS DUE TO WINTER, WORK WOULD RESUME IN THE SPRING OF 2023 AND CONTINUE UNTIL THE TWO CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS ARE COMPLETED. DURING THIS PERFORMANCE PERIOD CONSTRUCTION INSPECTIONS WOULD OCCUR, AND THE PROJECTS ARE EXPECTED TO COMPLETE BY EARLY SUMMER OF 2023.BENEFICIARIES:NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND MESA VERDE NATIONAL PARK WILL BENEFIT WITH THE ABILITY TO QUICKLY ADD TEMPORARY CAPACITY AND SUPPORT EXISTING FEDERAL WORKERS AS THEY WORK TO SUSTAIN PARK OPERATIONS AND RESPOND TO UNEXPECTED EVENTS AND ISSUES THAT OCCUR THROUGHOUT THE NATIONAL PARK SYSTEM. THE EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM PROMOTES ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IN GATEWAY COMMUNITIES NEAR NPS UNITS AND PROVIDES SUPPLEMENTAL INCOME TO INDIVIDUALS 55 YEARS AND OLDER.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):PROJECT WILL HIRE EXPERIENCED WORKERS TO FILL SEVERAL SHORT TERM NEEDS WITH IN THE PARK SUPPORTING NEPA EVALUATIONS, PROJECT MANAGEMENT, CONTRACT WRITING, TRAINING AND PROMOTING HEALTH AND SAFETY PROGRAMS FOR PARK STAFF.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:PROJECT WILL HIRE EXPERIENCED WORKERS TO FILL SEVERAL SHORT TERM NEEDS WITH IN THE PARK SUPPORTING NEPA EVALUATIONS, PROJECT MANAGEMENT, CONTRACT WRITING, TRAINING AND PROMOTING HEALTH AND SAFETY PROGRAMS FOR PARK STAFF. PARK RADIO SYSTEM WILL BE EVALUATED AND WORK INITIATED TO MAKE REPAIRS, SAFETY PROGRAM WILL BE SUPPORTED, TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED TO STAFF IN FACILITY MANAGEMENT.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PROJECT WILL SUPPORT SEVERAL PROJECTS THE PARK WILL BE IMPLEMENTING WITH PLANNED PROJECT FUNDING, REPAVING SOUTH GWMP PARKWAY (EXPECTED 2024), RESTORING CLARA BARTON NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE (2023), DEVELOPMENT OF GREAT FALLS, VA FACILITIES (2025). PARK RADIO SYSTEM WILL BE EVALUATED, AND WORK INITIATED TO MAKE REPAIRS, SAFETY PROGRAM WILL BE SUPPORTED, TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED TO STAFF IN FACILITY MANAGEMENT.

THE EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT AND AUGMENT THE CAPACITY OF THE NPS TO MEET ITS' MISSION GOALS AND OBJECTIVES IN AREAS WHERE IT LACKS SUFFICIENT EXPERTISE, TECHNICAL SKILLS AND/OR CAPACITY.NEW SOLUTIONS WILL ADVERTISE, RECRUIT, SCREEN CANDIDATES, AND ENROLLEE A SELECTED CANDIDATE, AGE 55+, TO SUPPORT PINNACLES NATIONAL PARK WITH TECHNICAL SUPPORT INCLUDING PROJECT MANAGEMENT FOR ALL ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE PLANNING AND CONSTRUCTION OF NEW FACILITIES, REHABILITATION OF EXISTING FACILITIES, AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF 5 YEAR ASSET MANAGEMENT PLAN.TASKS AND PROJECTS UNDERTAKEN UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT AND AUGMENT THE ABILITY OF THE NPS TO MAINTAIN AND SUPPORT OUR PARK UNITS AND PROGRAM OFFICES THAT INTERFACE WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES.

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT:THROUGH THE ENGAGEMENT OF HIGHLY QUALIFIED WORKERS IN A TEMPORARY CAPACITY, THE NPS CAN IN A COST EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT MANNER MEET ITS STRATEGIC AND MISSION GOALS OF PROTECTING AND MAINTAINING ITS PARK UNITS AND PROVIDE NECESSARY ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT TO FIELD PERSONAL. THIS PROGRAM WILL ALLOW THE NPS TO QUICKLY ADD TEMPORARY CAPACITY AND SUPPORT TO OUR FEDERAL WORKERS AS THEY WORK TO SUSTAIN OUR PARK OPERATIONS AND RESPOND TO UNEXPECTED EVENTS AND ISSUES THAT OCCUR THROUGHOUT THE SYSTEM. THE EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM WILL ALLOW THE NPS TO IMPLEMENT TEMPORARY FIXES AND ADDRESS CRITICAL PROBLEMS WHILE MORE PERMANENT SOLUTIONS ARE DEVELOPED AND EXECUTED. THIS PROGRAM WILL IN NO WAY DISPLACE CURRENT EMPLOYEES OR SUBSTITUTE FUTURE FEDERAL WORKERS.REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):DUE TO FEDERAL STAFF ATTRITION, SAGUARO NATIONAL PARK IS IN NEED OF SUPPORT FOR TWO CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS AT TWO DISTRICTS: (1) REHABILITATE THE GEORGE CLAYTON GREENE HOUSE, RINCON MOUNTAIN DISTRICT, AND (2) REPAIR HISTORIC RAMADA'S AND PROVIDE ACCESSIBLE PICNIC AREAS, SIGNAL HILL, TUCSON MOUNTAIN DISTRICT.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE ENROLLEE WILL PROVIDE CONSTRUCTION INSPECTION FOR ADHERENCE TO THE CONTRACT DOCUMENTS AND INDUSTRY STANDARDS, AND REPORT TO THE FACILITY MANAGER. THE ENROLLEE WILL ALSO REVIEW PRELIMINARY DESIGN, DESIGN, AND CONSTRUCTION DOCUMENTS SUCH AS DRAWINGS, SPECIFICATIONS, SPECIAL STUDIES/REPORTS AND SO FORTH FOR CONSTRUCTABILITY.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT AND AUGMENT THE CAPACITY OF THE NPS TO MEET ITS MISSION GOALS AND OBJECTIVES IN AREAS WHERE IT LACKS SUFFICIENT EXPERTISE, TECHNICAL SKILLS AND/OR CAPACITY.A SECONDARY GOAL OF THIS PROGRAM WILL BE TO PROMOTE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IN GATEWAY COMMUNITIES NEAR NPS UNITS AND PROVIDE SUPPLEMENTAL INCOME TO INDIVIDUALS 55 YEARS AND OLDER.BENEFICIARIES:SAGUARO NATIONAL PARK AND THE ESP INCUMBENT

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P-P-NPSA-22-030PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE CRPS DIRECTORATE IN MANAGING AND COMPLETING THE CONVERSION AND CONSOLIDATION OF WEB AND PRINT MEDIA INFORMATION AND RECORDS TO A REPOSITORY OF DOCUMENTS MEETING ALL NECESSARY ACCESSIBILITY AND COMPLIANCE REVIEW STANDARDS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE 508 COMPLIANCE SPECIALIST WILL SUPPORT THE CRPS WEB & PRINT MEDIA PROGRAM BY THE FOLLOWING:EVALUATE DOCUMENTS TO DETERMINE IF THEY SHOULD BECOME LIVE WEB CONTENT OR NEED TO BE RETAINED AS 508 COMPLIANT DOCUMENTS; REVIEW DOCUMENT EVALUATION WITH NPS STAFF; PROVIDE NOTES ON THE DETERMINATION OF EACH DOCUMENT FOR LIVE WEB CONTENT VS. ACCESSIBLE DOCUMENT; PREPARE CONTENT TO BE PUBLISHED BY OTHERS IN THE CONTENT MANAGEMENT SYSTEM; PROVIDE TEXT IN A WORD DOCUMENT; DEVELOP GUIDANCE, WORKFLOW, AND BEST PRACTICES TO BE DEVELOPED BY PROGRAMS TO ENSURE COMPLIANCE OF FUTURE PRODUCTS; AND CONDUCT TRAINING, FORMAL OR INFORMAL, TO ENSURE COMMON UNDERSTANDING OF ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES, GUIDANCE, WORKFLOW, AND BEST PRACTICES FOR PROGRAM STAFF TO APPLY TO THEIR OWN WORK.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE GOALS/OBJECTIVES ARE TO ENSURE 508 COMPLIANCE FOR DOCUMENTS IN THE WEB AND PRINT MEDIA PROGRAM'S WEB CONTENT, TO DRAFT GUIDANCE FOR CRPS SPECIFIC DOCUMENT 508 COMPLIANCE NEEDS AND TASKS, AND TO ADVISE PROGRAM STAFF ON THEIR ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES, AND TRAIN TASKS FOR 508 COMPLIANCE OF DOCUMENTS.BENEFICIARIES: ENROLLEE

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE AN EXPERIENCED HEAVY EQUIPMENT OPERATOR TO SUPPLEMENT THE C&O CANAL NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK OPERATIONS IN MAINTENANCE AND PRESERVATION ACTIVITIES WHILE THE FEDERAL POSITION IS BEING FILLED.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:AN EXPERIENCED HEAVY EQUIPMENT OPERATOR WILL OPERATE VARIOUS PIECES OF EQUIPMENT TO ASSIST WITH: DEBRIS REMOVAL, ROAD AND TOWPATH REPAIR, EQUIPMENT TRANSPORTATION, PARK APPROVED DIGGING, EQUIPMENT REPAIR, AND GENERAL MAINTENANCE WORK. THE RECIPIENT WILL ALSO SERVE AS A MENTOR FOR PARK EMPLOYEES BY SHARING EXPERIENCES AND OFFERING SUGGESTIONS BASED ON PRIOR WORK HISTORY.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:DURING THE LIFE OF THIS AGREEMENT, THE GOAL IS TO PROTECT AND MAINTAIN THE C&O CANAL NHP; ADD TEMPORARY CAPACITY TO NPS STAFF; AND PROVIDE SUPPLEMENTAL INCOME TO EXPERIENCED INDIVIDUALS 55 YEARS AND OLDER WHILE MENTORING C&O CANAL EMPLOYEES ON EQUIPMENT OPERATION.

THE EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT AND AUGMENT THE CAPACITY OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE TO MEET ITS' MISSION GOALS AND OBJECTIVES IN AREAS WHERE IT LACKS SUFFICIENT EXPERTISE, TECHNICAL SKILLS AND/OR CAPACITY. THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO EXPAND THE PUBLIC AFFAIRS ORGANIZATIONAL CAPACITY AND PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL SUPPORT AND MENTORING TO THE FEDERAL STAFF AT PARKS AND/OR PROGRAMS IN INTERIOR REGIONS 8, 9, 10, AND 12 (THE LEGACY PACIFIC WEST REGION). THE EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM ENROLLEE WILL SUPPORT THE REGIONAL PUBLIC AFFAIRS PROGRAM BY IMPROVING COMMUNICATIONS AND RELATIONSHIPS WITH VARIOUS STAKEHOLDERS, HELPING TO DEVELOP COMPREHENSIVE COMMUNICATIONS STRATEGIES AND SUPPORTING STAFF ON THE GROUND.
EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM, DESIGN TOOLS AND RESOURCES TO SUPPORT PARK MANAGEMENT

A.PERFORMANCE GOALS - THE EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT AND AUGMENT THE CAPACITY OF THE NPS TO MEET ITS' MISSION GOALS AND OBJECTIVES IN AREAS WHERE IT LACKS SUFFICIENT EXPERTISE, TECHNICAL SKILLS AND/OR CAPACITY. CURRENTLY THE NPS HAS A $12 BILLION PLUS DEFERRED MAINTENANCE BACKLOG AND OTHER CAPACITY ISSUES THAT ARE THREATENING TO INHIBIT THE ABILITY OF THE SERVICE TO ADEQUATELY PROTECT AND MAINTAIN THE TREASURED PUBLIC LAND OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA. ADDITIONALLY THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE NPS HAVE GROWN GREATLY OVER THE LAST SEVERAL DECADES BUT THE WORKFORCE HAS NOT ADEQUATELY AUGMENTED ITS CAPACITY. THIS HAS LED TO A DEFICIT OF TECHNICAL EXPERTISE AND CAPACITY IN SOME CRITICAL PROGRAM AREAS.B.PROJECT OBJECTIVES - ESTABLISH A MANAGEMENT FRAMEWORK TO GUIDE FUTURE DECISIONS AND ACTIONS FOR THE NORTH END OF CRATERS OF THE MOON NM&P. THIS POSITION WILL PROVIDE PROJECT MANAGEMENT SUPPORT INCLUDING PROFESSIONAL PLANNING AND FACILITATION SERVICES TO AN INTERDISCIPLINARY TEAM WITH THE OUTCOME BEING A WRITTEN PLANNING DOCUMENT FOR THE NORTH END THAT PROVIDES CLARITY AND GUIDANCE TO FUTURE PARK MANAGERS AND STAFF.THE ~10,000 ACRE 'NORTH END' OF CRATERS OF THE MOON WAS ADDED TO THE PARK IN 1928 AND IS WHERE THE CRATERS LAVA FLOWSMEET THE FOOTHILLS OF THE PIONEER MOUNTAINS, A SUBRANGE OF THE ROCKY MOUNTAINS. LOCATED ACROSS HIGHWAY 20/26/93 (AKA HIGHWAY 20) FROM THE CRMO VISITOR CENTER AND LOOP ROAD, THIS PORTION OF THE PARK INCLUDES IMMENSELY DIFFERENT AND IMPORTANT HABITAT TYPES FROM THE AREAS SOUTH OF HIGHWAY 20. IN CONTRAST TO THOSE LANDS, THE NORTH END INCLUDES OLDER AND THEREFORE MORE DENSELY VEGETATED LAVA FLOWS AND CINDER CONES, SAGEBRUSH, ASPEN, WILLOWS, AND DOUGLAS-FIR TREES. THE SLOPES OF THE PIONEER MOUNTAINS ALSO CONTAIN NUMEROUS SPRINGS THAT FEED SMALL CREEKS AND WETLANDS AND IS HOME TO ABUNDANT WILDLIFE AND CULTURALLY IMPORTANT RESOURCES.THEREFORE, THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE TODEVELOP A MANAGEMENT FRAMEWORK TO GUIDE FUTURE DECISIONS AND ACTIONS ON THE NORTH END OF CRMO. THIS INCLUDES DEVELOPING A RANGE OF POTENTIAL ALTERNATIVES, ASSESSING THE ANTICIPATED EFFECTS OF EACH, SELECTING A PREFERRED ALTERNATIVE, AND CREATING A COMPREHENSIVE MANAGEMENT PLAN TO GUIDE FUTURE MANAGEMENT OF THIS ECOLOGICALLY SENSITIVE AND CULTURALLY IMPORTANT AREA OF THE PARK.THERE SHALL BE A TWO- OR THREE-DAY ROUNDTABLE DISCUSSION WITH THE CRATERS OF THE MOON STAFF. THE ROUNDTABLE WILL GATHER THE INPUT FROM ALL PARK EMPLOYEES AND DIVISIONS, TO ENSURE ALL POTENTIAL SOLUTIONS ARE HEARD, IN HOPE TO GATHER ENOUGH INFORMATION FOR A COHESIVE DECISION AND REPORT THE PARK CAN CONSIDER IMPLEMENTING FOR THE FUTURE USE OF THE NORTH END OF CRMO.

PURPOSE OF AWARDTHE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR HIGHLY QUALIFIED INDIVIDUALS TO SUPPORT THE ORGANIZATIONAL OBJECTIVES OF SEKI. THESE INDIVIDUALS WILL WORK ON PROJECTS THAT ENTAIL TECHNICAL, ANALYTICAL, PLANNING AND NECESSARY PROFESSIONAL SUPPORT TO FIELD STAFF IN ANALYTICAL SUPPORT, PROJECT PLANNING, ENVIRONMENTAL COMPLIANCE, FISCAL ADMINISTRATION AND BIOLOGY AND RELATED SCIENTIFIC DISCIPLINES. WORK WILL FOCUS ON SUPPORTING POST-FIRE RECOVERY NEEDS OF THE PARK INCLUDING BURNED AREA EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN EXECUTION AND COORDINATION, BURNED AREA REHABILITATION PLAN COORDINATION, AND DISASTER SUPPLEMENT RECOVERY PROJECT PLANNING ASSISTANCE AND INTEGRATION WITH BAER AND BAR. NPS PROVIDES THE FUNDS, COMPUTER, TASKS ORDER, WORK ASSIGNMENTS AND OVERSIGHT FOR THE ESP ENROLLEES, WHILE NEW SOLUTIONS ADVERTISES, RECRUITS, SCREENS, REFERENCE CHECKS AND ENROLLS CANDIDATES, AND ADMINISTERS PAY AND BENEFITS TO ENROLLEES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:WORK WILL FOCUS ON SUPPORTING POST-FIRE RECOVERY NEEDS OF THE PARK INCLUDING BURNED AREA EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN EXECUTION AND COORDINATION, BURNED AREA REHABILITATION PLAN COORDINATION, AND DISASTER SUPPLEMENT RECOVERY PROJECT PLANNING ASSISTANCE AND INTEGRATION WITH BAER AND BARPERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:TECHNICAL SERVICES- SEKI WILL SEEK SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS TO DEVELOP AND DELIVER CONTENT TO INCREASE ORGANIZATIONAL EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVENESS. NOWCC WILL PROVIDE QUALIFIED PROFESSIONALS TO SUPPORT THE EXECUTION OF SPECIALIZED PROJECT WORK THAT THE NPS DOES NOT HAVE THE SPECIFIC EXPERTISE OR CAPACITY TO COMPLETE, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO: PROJECT MANAGEMENT, ENVIRONMENTAL COMPLIANCE, FINANCIAL ADMINISTRATION, AND BIOLOGY, AND OTHER SUPPORT OF SCIENTIFIC AND TECHNICAL POST-FIRE PROJECT WORK. BENEFICIARIES: THE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO UTILIZE THE EXPERTISE OF INDIVIDUALS AGES 55 AND OVER THROUGH THE EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM (ESP). THISAGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT THE NPS MISSION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RESTORATION OF OUR NATION'S PUBLIC LANDS. TASKS AND PROJECTS UNDERTAKEN UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT AND AUGMENT THE ABILITY OF THE SERVICE TO MAINTAIN AND SUPPORT OUR PARK UNITS AND PROGRAM OFFICES THAT INTERFACE WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES.

NEW SOLUTIONS (FORMERLY NOWCC) WILL ADVERTISE THE PROJECT MANAGEMENT POSITION AND RECRUIT, SCREEN, AND ENROLL A CANDIDATE INTO THE ESP TO SUPPORT THE PROJECT MANAGEMENT NEEDS OF JODA, DESCRIBED IN THE TASK AGREEMENT AND POSITION DESCRIPTION.PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE OVERALL GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO REVISE MANAGEMENT OF THE HISTORIC CANT RANCH CULTURAL LANDSCAPE LOCATED IN THE SHEEP ROCK UNIT OF THE MONUMENT BECAUSE CURRENT PRACTICES ARE FINANCIALLY AND ECOLOGICALLY UNSUSTAINABLE. TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL THE PARK'S 2017 FOUNDATION STATEMENT CALLS FOR PREPARING A "CANT RANCH AGRICULTURAL MANAGEMENT PLAN," AND THE SPECIFIC PERFORMANCE GOALS FOR THIS PROJECT ARE INTENDED TO LAY THE FOUNDATION FOR THIS PLAN AND FOR PRESUMED PREPARATION OF AN ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT. TO THIS END THE PERFORMANCE GOAL FOR THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS TO FULFILL ALL LEGAL, POLICY AND PRACTICAL REQUIREMENTS FOR INTERAGENCY, CIVIC AND TRIBAL ENGAGEMENT, ALSO REFERRED TO AS "PRE NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY ACT [NEPA] DUE DILIGENCE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:PRODUCE A PROJECT CHARTER THAT FORMALIZES AN INTERDISCIPLINARY TEAM FOR PLANNING PURPOSES AND FOSTERS COMMUNICATION, COORDINATION AND COLLABORATION. PRODUCE AN "INTERNAL SCOPING AND CIVIC ENGAGEMENT REPORT" TO CAPTURE THE RESULTS OF THE SUBJECT EFFORTS AND DIRECTLY INFORM FUTURE PLANNING. THE REPORT SHALL AT A MINIMUM IDENTIFY KEY STAKEHOLDERS, CLARIFY PROJECT PURPOSE AND NEED, ISSUES, AND PROVIDE A "PRELIMINARY PREFERRED MANAGEMENT ALTERNATIVE" PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INTERNAL SCOPING. DEVELOP A CHARTER TO FORMALIZE AN INTERDISCIPLINARY TEAM OF PARK STAFFS, ACADEMICS FROM OREGON STATE UNIVERSITY-BEND CAMPUS, REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE CONFEDERATED TRIBES OF WARM SPRINGS, REGIONAL NATIONAL PARK SERVICE SCIENTISTS AND CULTURAL RESOURCE SPECIALISTS, AND REPRESENTATIVES FROM THE OREGON DEPARTMENT OF FISH AND WILDLIFE. FACILITATE SEVERAL PLANNING SESSIONS TO CLARIFY THE PRELIMINARY PURPOSE, NEED, AND OBJECTIVES FOR TAKING ACTION, ISSUES, IMPACT TOPICS, AND POTENTIAL RANGE OF ALTERNATIVES.CIVIC ENGAGEMENT. IDENTIFY KEY STAKEHOLDERS AND DEVELOP A COMMUNICATIONS STRATEGY SCALED TO THE LEVEL OF POTENTIAL PUBLIC INTEREST, PROJECT SCOPE AND POTENTIAL FOR PUBLIC CONTROVERSY. CONDUCT PUBLIC OUTREACH ACTIVITIES TO UNDERSTAND SUFFICIENTLY EXTERNAL INTERESTS, ISSUES, CONCERNS, AND POTENTIAL RISKS.PREPARE AN INTERNAL SCOPING/CIVIC ENGAGEMENT REPORT THAT CAPTURES THE RESULTS OF INTERNAL SCOPING AND CIVIC ENGAGEMENT, WHICH WILL BE USED AS THE FOUNDATION FOR FUTURE PLANNING, INCLUDING PRESUMED PREPARATION OF AN ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENT.ASSIST THE SUPERINTENDENT WILL MISCELLANEOUS YET IMPORTANT ASPECTS OF THE PROJECT, INCLUDING PROJECT SCHEDULING, PREPARATION OF BRIEFING STATEMENTS, PRESENTATIONS, AND FURTHER DEVELOPMENT OF THE EXISTING ADMINISTRATIVE RECORD.BENEFICIARIES:SUPPORTS THE NPS MISSION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND RESTORATION OF OUR NATION'S PUBLIC LANDS. TASKS AND PROJECTS UNDERTAKEN UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT AND AUGMENT THE ABILITY OF THE SERVICE TO MAINTAIN AND SUPPORT OUR PARK UNITS AND PROGRAM OFFICES THAT INTERFACE WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES.

NOWCC WILL RECRUIT, SCREEN, AND ONBOARD AN EXPERIENCED WORKER AGE 55+ TO SUPPORT GLBA BY PROVIDING TECHNICAL REVIEW OF NPS-PROVIDED MAPPING AND LIDAR DATA, DEVELOP A PRELIMINARY PROPOSED ROUTE FOR APPROXIMATELY 4-6 MILES OF NEW TRAIL, ENGAGE IN A SITE VISIT TO GROUND AND FINE TUNE THE PROPOSED ROUTE AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL TRAINING TO NPS AND PARTNER ORGANIZATION STAFF IN SUSTAINABLE TRAIL DESIGN, BUILDING AND MAINTENANCE. NOWCC WILL MANAGE THE ENROLLEE AND PROVIDE HR AND ADMINISTRATIVE FUNCTIONS WHILE THE PARK WILL ASSIGN AND MONITOR WORK.

PURPOSE OF AWARD:NOWCC WILL ADVERTISE, RECRUIT, AND ENROLL AN EXPERIENCED 55+ PERSON TO SUPPORT GOGA IN REVIEWING, ANALYZING, AND MAKING RECOMMENDATIONS ON THE ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE OF THE FACILITIES DIVISION AS WELL AS PROCESSES AND PROCEDURES THAT COULD BE IMPROVED, CONSOLIDATED, OR ELIMINATED.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE PARTICIPANT WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING SERVICES AT GOLDEN GATE NATIONAL RECREATION AREA:THE PARTICIPANT WILL START REVIEWING THE EXISTING ORGANIZATION CHART FOR THE FACILITIES DIVISION, FIRST MAKING RECOMMENDATIONS ON ORGANIZATIONAL EFFECTIVENESS FOR THE BUILDINGS AND UTILITIES SUB-GROUPS, AND THEN MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR THE REMAINING DIVISIONAL SUB-GROUPS. THE DELIVERABLE WILL BE IN THE FORM OF A WRITTEN REPORT. THE PARTICIPANT SHALL REVIEW THE PARK'S 5-YEAR PROJECT PLAN FOR CYCLIC MAINTENANCE AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR CHANGES AND IMPROVEMENTS BASED ON THE INCREASED FUNDING BRACKET. THE DELIVERABLE SHALL BE IN THE FORM OF A WRITTEN REPORT. PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE SPECIFIC GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST THE PARK IN ANALYZING THE STRUCTURE AND PROCESSES WITHIN THE FACILITIES ORGANIZATION AND MAKE RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPROVEMENTS AND STREAMLINING OF PROCESSES. THE ESP PARTICIPANT MUST HAVE A STRONG WORKING KNOWLEDGE OF DOI/NPS ORGANIZATION, GOVERNING LAWS, AND POLICIES IN ORDER TO PROPERLY REVIEW AND ANALYZE THE ORGANIZATION. ADDITIONALLY, THE ENROLLEE SKILLS MAY BE USED TO PROVIDE SUPPORT AND MENTORING TO NEW NPS STAFF AS NEEDEDBENEFICIARIES:DOI PRIORITY:GREATLY IMPROVE, STREAMLINE, AND MODERNIZE NPS MANAGEMENT AND BUSINESS PRACTICES,ANDENSURE ACCOUNTABILITY TOOURSELVES, OUR PARTNERS, AND THE AMERICAN PEOPLETHE USE OF PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS ALIGNS WITH MANY OF THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR GOALS FOR FOSTERING BETTER RELATIONSHIPS WITH THE COMMUNITIES IT SERVES AND INCREASING THE EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVE OF NPS OPERATIONS. THIS TASK AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT THE GOLDEN GATE NATIONAL RECREATION AREA'S DIVISION OF FACILITY MANAGEMENT.

THE EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT AND AUGMENT THE CAPACITY OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE TO MEET ITS' MISSION GOALS AND OBJECTIVES IN AREAS WHERE IT LACKS SUFFICIENT EXPERTISE, TECHNICAL SKILLS AND/OR CAPACITY. FOR THIS PROJECT, AN EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM PARTICIPANT WILL ASSIST WITH PROCESSING FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA) REQUESTS AT POINT REYES NATIONAL SEASHORE. THE FOIA STATUTE HAS VERY SHORT TIMELINES WHICH ARE DIFFICULT TO COMPLY WITH GIVEN THE CURRENT STAFFING. ADDING AN EXPERIENCED SERVICES PROGRAM PARTICIPANT TO THE FOIA PROGRAM WILL ALLOW POINT REYES NATIONAL SEASHORE TO RESPOND IN A TIMELY MANNER TO THE REQUESTING PARTIES. THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO CLEAR THE BACKLOGGED CASES AND MEET THE REQUIRED TIMELINES FOR ANY NEW CASES RECEIVED DURING THE COURSE OF THIS PROJECT.
